story:
The DevelopHER Awards

My name is Vickie, and I founded SyncDevelopHER back in 2013. Since then I have been running regular free events for members of the local tech community to help promote women in tech. 

Currently in the UK only 17% of those that work in tech are women, and that's something we are trying to make common knowledge, both genders need to acknowledge the issue before things can change- that's why we intend to promote women in tech to the local community. 

Help fund the DevelopHER Award

We're running a DevelopHER Awards evening, it's not for profit so as always we are relying entirely on sponsors. That's why we need you to help! Donate as little or as much as you want, help us to acknowledge the amazing women in tech in East Anglia. 

We are trying to raise the funds to cover the costs of the main award. There will be 11 awards and then the DevelopHER award which we go to an overall winner of the evening. 

The event is invite only, so if you donate more than £20 you will receive your very own invite to the event. The event will include a wine reception, a buffet meal and the event presentation.

Are you a small company that can't afford one of our main sponsorship packages? Donate here and we'll include your logo during the presentation of the DevelopHER award. 

We've put a target of £750, but we'd love to raise even more so we can hold an even bigger and better event. 

Please help support the Norwich tech community and help give local women in tech the recognition that they deserve.

Know someone you want to nominate? Head over to DevelopHERAwards.com for details of the different awards and when nominations open.

story:
How do you want to make a difference?

My name is Olivia Kurbs and I am a 19 year old college student. At a young age, the idea of helping others was something that constantly appeared in my thoughts. Being someone who can make a difference in someone else’s life, big or small, is incredibly important to me. It wasn't until recently that I decided to push myself a little bit more out of my comfort zone to reach out into the world rather than just my neck of the woods.

This upcoming summer I will be traveling to the Dominican Republic with an incredible organization, otherwise known as International Student Volunteers. During my time there, I will have the opportunity to work with people by helping them sustain a better community. We will be educating impoverished children, building homes, improving their access to something as simple as water, and so much more.

Having this opportunity to travel to a place where help is needed will be incredibly rewarding and something that I have wanted to do for my entire life.


Help is needed!

During my time in the Dominican Republic, I plan on really helping the people who live there. With that being said, donations are graciously accepted and will go directly to my volunteer trip. The costs include:

-  Materials needed to complete our project

-  Airfare

Being able to travel to a different country, as I have mentioned before, is an incredible thing. Financially though, it is a very difficult task, especially where I am currently. The dreams that I have are much bigger than anything in my life and I hope that people can understand and really help me make what I want to do in this world a reality. This is only the start of the impact I am going to make on this Earth.


    Spread the word!

    Any type of donation is greatly appreciated but if you are unable to make a contribution I hope that you will spread the word about the journey I am taking. Please share my link with family, friends, businesses, and on different forms of social media! (Facebook,Twitter,etc.)


    “We cannot change the cards we are dealt, just how we play the hand.” –Randy Pausch

    This quote above is something I hold dear to my heart because it speaks volumes to me. We are born into this world not knowing what is going to happen. We face so many ups and downs and various obstacles that may set us back or potentially push us forward. But no matter what life throws at us, it is how we choose to live that matters.  Our choices in life affect the ones around us. Why not make that a positive effect? How we choose to deal with things or be involved in our communities is all up to us. How will you play your hand?

story:
Welcome to the crowdfunding opportunity to start a fishing charter enterprise in Sierpe, Costa Rica. 

We Never Thought We Would Work Again

My name is Jesse Peeler. I owned and operated a successful charter fishing business for 20 years in southwest Florida. After selling our business my wife and I retired to Costa Rica believing we would never work again. 

That is, until we discovered the unbelievably good fishing in the Sierpe River and Drake Bay area in the Osa Peninsula of Costa Rica.

We were so excited to find this area and what it offered that we decided to start the J&J Fishing venture. I am ready to fish again. I am excited. And I want you to be part of this adventure. 

We want to make this dream a reality now. Using this platform of raising money we not only hope to fund the start up J&J Fishing, but through the perks offered in this effort we plan on generating our client base. You will notice that our perks are basically prepaid charters that are significantly discounted. This supports our desire to make our contributors our clients. I want to share with other sport fishing enthusiasts and contributors the terrific fishing available in the Sierpe River and offshore in Drake Bay.

We thank you for considering our campaign and for your support. We are looking forward to you using these perks so that you might enjoy the spectacular fishing that prompted my wife and me to sell the house we thought we would be in 'forever' ....and..... ....to want to work again.

Captain Jesse, on board with friend, Captain Pablo, and on Captain Pablo's boat on Drake Bay.

What We Need & What You Get

The type of boat and motor, tackle requirements, and start up costs are based on my 20+ years experience in the charter fishing business and dictate what is necessary to make this a viable project. The charter fishing business that I started, operated, and eventually sold was and still is one of the most successful charter fishing businesses in southwest Florida. My 20 years of experience gives me the knowledge to start and operate this company in the same successful manner. I want you to be part of my success. 

The breakdown of our funding needs are as follows:

·     $42,000  Boat and Motor

·         5,000   Tackle

·         5,000   Campaign Costs

·        3,000   Misc. Start Up Costs, including boat prep  

The boat will be made by a local manufacturer specializing in commercial boats that are used for transportation and fishing on the Sierpe River and Drake Bay. We have already selected the hull type and it is a 22' center console that can accommodate four anglers easily.

The motor/power will be a 150 Yamaha 4 stroke purchased from a Yamaha dealer in Sierpe. What a surprisingly good break to have a parts dealer and a certified Yamaha mechanic minutes away. 

If you or those you know love fishing, we hope you  will use the perks offered in this campaign for yourself or as gifts to others.

Our current charter rates are $60 per person per hour for river tours, $450 1/2 day charter and $850 for a full day charter. The fishing charter rates are all inclusive for four people. 

In the event our funding needs aren't completely met, we will fund the balance required from the funds received from the eventual sale of our house which is currently on the market (www.costaricadream.net).

Jeane and I are totally commtted to this exciting venture and we want you to share this life-dream with us. Thank you

BOATING TOWARDS THE TOWN OF SIERPE, a small fishing village in the Osa Peninsula. Sierpe is the stepping off place, only by boat, to exclusive resorts, Corcovado National Park, off shore fishing in Drake Bay and outrageous fishing on the Sierpe River.

The future of Sierpe and J&J Fishing

One of the reasons the fishing in this area is so good is because up until this time it has been difficult to access and hence, under fished. Now, the improvement in the roads, the local airfield, and Costa Rica’s commitment to facilitate traffic to and from a new International Airport that will soon be built has radically changed the access to Sierpe and the immediate area.

The following article is from Latin America Real Estate News:

Knowing when an area is going to move from low demand to high demand is key to smart real estate investing. One of the best investment indicators is new infrastructure, especially new airports which open international access to underdeveloped regions of exceptional value.

During Costa Rica's first boom, the Liberia airport in the northern region was upgraded to receive international flights. Real estate sales in Guanacaste exploded, high-end resorts and developments flourished, including flag ship developments like the Papagayo Four Seasons hotel. New highways were added and old ones reworked -- tourism and demand soared. International flights started arriving in Liberia in 2002 and while that investment wave has subsided, the Gold Coast is still one of Costa Rica's best investment bets.

Now Palmar Sur, in Costa Rica's southern zone, is receiving international status with a $42 million expansion to the national airport, Palmar Sur Airport. The same scenario is starting to play out as it did in the northern region. Although the project is currently out for tender there are whispers of closed door deals already circulating and tell tale signs in the real estate market that something big is on the horizon for the southern zone.

According to Costa Rica´s Civil Aviation Authority (Aviación Civil) development in underway between the towns of Sierpe and Palmar Sur, with the target opening date set for 2014.

Phase one of the airport will boast a runway approximately 2,500 meters long, large enough for Boeing 747s, Airbus and A320s. The terminal in phase one will accommodate 150 passengers simultaneously, while transatlantic flights will be added in phase two, increasing the terminal size.

Other support infrastructure has ramped up including the new Caldera highway (Pista del Sol) and expansion of the Costarena Sur highway. This is driving more tourists to visit the south zone, as travel time from the Central Valley to the region is reduced to approximately 3.5 hours. A new hospital -- a requirement for an international airport -- is now fully functional, including emergency helicopter service. Highway access onto the OSA Peninsula from Palmar Sur was also greatly improved.

The entire southern zone is expected to mirror the growth witnessed in the northern region with the arrival of the new international airport. Interest in Dominical real estate, just 60 mile north of Palmar Sur, has already seen an uptick in focus and sales. Dominical, although far less developed than other regions, is well known locally as one of Costa Rica's gems. However, the recent infrastructure improvements and the expansion of the airport has brought it to the attention of investors and developers.

 Southern Costa Rica is the home of the famous Corcovado National Park on the OSA Peninsula, a place National Geographic called "the most biologically intense place on earth." Opening this unique tropical eco region to international access has many experts in the Costa Rica real estate market excited about the prospect of a second growth boom.

 


EXISTING PALMAR SUR AIRPORT is a 15 minute drive to Sierpe. From the international airport in San Jose air time in 30 minutes to the Palmar Sur Airport. By car, travel time is approximately 4 hours to Sierpe.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about fishing in Sierpe and J&J Fishing.  And, remember, a charter fishing trip is a great gift!!!!

Thank you again for your time and interest.    

Contact us at JJFishingcostarica@gmail.com, Facebook at J&J Fishing Costa Rica or www.jjfishingcostarica.com                                                   

Jesse and Jeane

story:
Skrap Pack was a brand created by Gilbert Melendez, defining him and fellow Gracie Fighter teammates including MMA superstars: Nate Diaz, Nick Diaz and Jake Shields. With MMA being the world’s fastest growing sport, the Skrap Pack Fight Shop will stock the best technical performance brands, in addition to their private label, lifestyle brands and collectibles, all catered to Mixed Martial Arts. The San Francisco storefront in Stonestown Galleria will hold special events, fighter signings and will be the home base for all MMA needs.

The funds earned through this campaign will go directly into making Skrap Pack stronger. The lease is signed and the shelves are up. We're continuing to bring in the best brands in MMA and booking the hottest stars that you want to meet.

With your contributions, we're bringing you closer than ever to the action. Whether you donate small or large, not only is it extremely appreciated, but you will receive exclusive products and once in a lifetime opportunities.

Leaving the store's fate in the hands of the judges is not an option as our track records only point towards success. With leading business experience and connections all over the industry, Skrap Pack is bred to thrive.




About Us:

Gilbert Melendez, MMA world champion and Jon Barretto, owner of streetwear store and brand Fully Laced, met years ago at an MMA collectibles show, unknowingly, that their paths will cross in the years to follow through apparel trade shows and patrons at each of their respective companies.

Gilbert is decorated with accomplishments as an MMA professional with the Strikeforce Lightweight Championship belt, and a superstar in the world’s largest MMA franchise, the UFC.

Keri Anne Melendez, wife of Gilbert, brings years of experience in Muay Thai/Kickboxing, and is coming off of a recent win in a newly-signed Bellator Kickboxing contract where she will continue to be a rising star. Together, Gilbert and Keri own one of the Bay Area’s most respected MMA gyms, El Niño Training Center.

Jon and wife, Melanie Barretto are retail fashion veterans, managing a streetwear and lifestyle boutique in Stonestown Galleria for the past 6 years and building a world-renowned brand with Fully Laced.

As their successes continue to grow with wins and business development, the time has come to combine strengths, fuel their passions and create a brand for the MMA community.

story:
Featuring a durable four-way stretch material our shoes are easy to slip on and off and prevent sand from entering the shoe. The outer sole of our shoe offers a no slip grip achieved with an rugged design. This enhances surface contact allowing your feet to stay firmly planted even in wet and slippery conditions. An internal cushioned insole provides a great deal of comfort to your stride improving impact resistance and keeping your feet safe and comfortable.

Whether you're walking along the beach, strolling around town, hit the water park or walking by the pool, the rubber outsole of our water shoes will give you best grip and reduce the chance of slipping. Perfect for the poolside and beach water activities, relief from clunky sneakers or high heels, our shoes can also be used for activities such as aqua aerobics and yoga, while providing great flex and traction.

 

Ultimate Versatility

Our stylish water shoes can be used in and around the pool, at the beach, during your favorite sport activity, or just casually around.
 

 

 

Rubber Outsole & Foot Safety

4 mm Solid tread protects your feet from being hurt by sharp rocks, shells, broken glass or other objects and prevent sunburns. 

 

 

Excellent Traction

Rubber outsole give you great grip and traction on slippery and wet surfaces.

 

Ultra Comfortable & Fit

Breathable and smooth fabrics with fine stretch on uppers. Like socks, flexible and comfortable.

 

 

Slip-on Convenience

Smooth neck design prevents chafing when wearing our water shoes.

 

 

 

Water resistant insoles included

 

 

 

Extremely Lightweight & Flexible

 

 

 

Easy to wash(Machine wash cold/air dry)

 

 

Full size for option


INFMETRY Water Shoes are Perfect for:
+ Beach Walking
+ Diving
+ Swimming Pools
+ Saunas
+ Showers/Baths
+ Spas
+ Surfing
+ Snorkeling
+ Sand Volleyball
+ Standup Paddle Boarding
+ Water Sports
+ Water Aerobics

 

Color: Black, Blue, Pink, Gray

Size Chart:                                                                                          

8.74" Feet Length/4Y Big Kid/5.5 US Women
9.02" Feet Length/4.5Y Big Kid/6.5 US Women
9.25" Feet Length/5.5Y Big Kid/7 US Women/6 US Men
9.49" Feet Length/6Y Big Kid/8 US Women/6.5 US Men
9.76" Feet Length/7Y Big Kid/8.5 USWomen/7.5 USMen
10.08" Feet Length/9.5 US Women/8 US Men
10.24" Feet Length/10 US Women/9 US Men
10.51" Feet Length/11 US Women/9.5 US Men
10.75" Feet Length/11.5 US Women/10.5 US Men
10.98" Feet Length/12 US Women/11 US Men
11.26" Feet Length/12 US Men

Sizes and colors will be requested in a survey sent to your email address 12 days after you pledge (due to Indiegogo refund policy)...

Like socks, flexible and comfortable.  Slip-on ConvenienceSmooth neck design prevents chafing when wearing our water shoes.   Water resistant insoles included   Extremely Lightweight & Flexible   Easy to wash(Machine wash cold/air dry)  Full size for optionINFMETRY Water Shoes are Perfect for:+ Beach Walking+ Diving+ Swimming Pools+ Saunas+ Showers/Baths+ Spas+ Surfing+ Snorkeling+ Sand Volleyball+ Standup Paddle Boarding+ Water Sports+ Water Aerobics Color: Black, Blue, Pink, GraySize Chart:                                                                                          8.74" Feet Length/4Y Big Kid/5.5 US Women9.02" Feet Length/4.5Y Big Kid/6.5 US Women9.25" Feet Length/5.5Y Big Kid/7 US Women/6 US Men9.49" Feet Length/6Y Big Kid/8 US Women/6.5 US Men9.76" Feet Length/7Y Big Kid/8.5 USWomen/7.5 USMen10.08" Feet Length/9.5 US Women/8 US Men10.24" Feet Length/10 US Women/9 US Men10.51" Feet Length/11 US Women/9.5 US Men10.75" Feet Length/11.5 US Women/10.5 US Men10.98" Feet Length/12 US Women/11 US Men11.26" Feet Length/12 US MenSizes and colors will be requested in a survey sent to your email address 12 days after you pledge (due to Indiegogo refund policy)...

story:
What is Bivystick?

Bivystick gives you peace of mind when you are off the grid by turning your cell phone into a satellite communication device. With no contract or activation fees, you can turn it on only when you need and save money when you don't. Bivystick allows you to send and receive text messages, share your location, track your path, send an SOS message in case of emergency, and access detailed weather forecasts when you are out of phone service.  All of this seamlessly integrated with Bivy app and it’s database of more than 45,000 trails, climbing routes and waterways. Plus, recharge your phone 2- 3 times with the 5200 mAh backup battery so you can get that message out when needed. Not only will you feel safer while you explore new areas, your loved ones will sleep easily by keeping track of your location and status. It is the ultimate tool for the modern day adventurer. With Bivystick you Stay Safe and Found.

 

 

Features

  • No contract or commitment. Activate it only when you need it. 
  • Send and receive text messages from anywhere in the world. 
  • Share your location anytime.
  • Track your path and share it with anyone you choose. Keep yourself and your loved ones aware of where you've been. 
  • Share your updates ad location to Facebook and Twitter. 
  • Offline maps eliminate the need to carry a separate GPS unit.
  • SOS in case of emergency. Communicate with EMS to ensure proper and efficient rescue. 
  • Accurate point weather forecast at any time.
  • 5200 mAh battery to operate the Bivystick, plus charge your phone 2-3 times. 

 

 

Connect via Bluetooth

Bivystick connects to your phone via Bluetooth, giving you familiarity and ease of use to efficiently get the message out quickly. The device charges via USB. You can always tell how much battery life you have left from LED indicator lights. 

 

 

Small, Simple, Lightweight

With its small and compact size, it easily fits into the pocket of your backpack, jacket, fanny pack, or murse. We don't care where you stick it. It also saves you space from carrying an additional battery for your phone, headlamp, etc... With a 5200 mAh battery, it keeps the satellite communication going and can also recharge your phone 2-3 times. It weighs only 6oz. 

 

 

Tech Specs

  • Weight - 6 oz. About the same as your smartphone
  • Battery - 5200 mAh. Enough to run the Bivystick for a week or give your phone a boost when needed. 
  • Connector - Charge via micro USB and connect via Bluetooth for use. 
  • Space Stuff (Satellites) - We use the Iridium satellite network that gives 100% global coverage
  • Operating Temp - -5 to 125 degrees F.  
  • Ruggedness - IPX6, Protected from rain, dust, dirt, weather, and water being splashed on it. 

Included in the box

  • Bivystick
  • Micro USB charge cord
  • Premium Bivy App access to offline maps and more
  • Carabiner and cord for connecting to backpack, tent, a camel saddle, etc...

 

Share Your Location

Bivystick lets you share your location with anyone who has a cell phone. With our detailed topo maps and huge database of trailheads and adventures, it will be easy for anyone to see exactly where you are. 

 

Affordable Data, No Commitment. 

 

Bivystick data plans are simple. We're not an insurance company trying to prey off of your fears and doubts. But we are experienced climbers, skiers, backcountry enthusiasts that know when things don't go as planned, it's nice to be prepared.  There is no need to commit hundreds of dollars to data just to have peace of mind. Or to have to worry about how to get the most bang for your buck. Here is how Bivystick credits work.

1 credit = 1 action with the Bivystick.

  • You want to send or receive a text, that's one credit. 
  • Want to share your location, that's one credit. 
  • Want a weather report, that's one credit. 
  • 1 hour of tracking your path, that's one credit.

You get the idea. You can buy our base plan of data starting at 10 credits per month and scale to as many credits as you want.  If you don't use all your credits, they roll over for as long as you keep the base plan active. Keeping it simple, flexible and commitment-free. 

$17.99 gets you started with our base plan. Then you can add as many credits as you need at a lower price. As long as you continue your service, all unused credits will roll over.

Why We Are Better

 

Bivy App 

Your Ultimate Free Adventure Guide

Bivystick works seamlessly with the Bivy app. With 45,000+ adventures in our database across the country, there is always an adventure nearby. You can find trails, waterways, and climbing routes perfect to fit your style and appetite. Plus you become a member of a growing outdoor community. 

 

With Bivy app you can track all of your adventures. Keep track of your miles, elevation, and how much time remaining at your current pace. Plus it keeps a record of all your completed adventures. It's like having a really awesome adventure resume. Just in case anyone doubts how rad you are on the weekends.

 

Risks and challenges

We are in the final stages of design and software development. If you have any suggestions or software features you would like us to try, please let us know. We are making this product for the everyday adventurer.

story:
Please find detailed product reviews at the bottom of the page!

Find us now here: https://keyfender.de/

Losing our car key on the beach was a very expensive and even more annoying affair. After this experience we did some research for the right option to take the electronic car key with us safely. We wanted to prevent the trouble of being locked out of our car again in the wrong moment and at a place with no service around.

After we realized that sealing the car key into a plastic bag is a too fragile solution and leaving it behind in or around the car will ultimately invalidate the insurance, we started to develop our own solution. The idea of the Keyfender® was born.

Your car key is only safe when it’s with you. But if you are going onto the water or into nature under rough conditions, the delicate electronic key has to stay dry.  You need a reliable way to carry it. The Keyfender® is designed to protect modern car keys and it goes where you go.

Our goal was to create a product that is as functional, flexible, reliable and handy as it is good looking.

This is the list of features that we implemented in the Keyfender® development: 

Keyfender® protects your electronic car key from water, sand and shocks. 

  • Waterproof up to 10 m depth (IP 68 protection class)
  • Elastic window to operate the key in the box 
  • UV, salt water and oil resistant 
  • Stays afloat with key inside
  • 2 different options to attach the case 
  • Temperature range -10°C – 45°C
  • Striking color
  • Comes with neoprene lanyard and short strap
  • Contains 3 self-adhesive foam pads to level out different key sizes

Supplied with a high-quality neoprene strap and an extra adjustable belt, you can always carry the key case with you. The Keyfender® has been intensively tested and awarded DEKRA's IP 68 protection class for water resistance up to 10 meters. The Keyfender® is made in Germany.

                                                   
           Keyfender testing under real condition by Mario Rodwald in Capetown. Enjoy!

The Keyfender® car key case fits for keys of 95% of all vehicles on the market. 

Audi, BMW, Citroen, Fiat, SEAT, Skoda, Ford, Land Rover, Mercedes, Opel, Peugeot, Renault, VW, Chrysler, Land Rover, Range Rover, Dodge, Mitsubishi, Suzuki, Nissan...

Some of the keys we tested for Keyfender®.

To make sure your key fits inside the Keyfender® we include three self-adhesive but removable pads into the package.  After choosing the right pad for your key it won’t rattle inside the Keyfender® and you are able to operate the buttons in a comfortable way. 

 

              

 

Car keys with fold-out and fixed blade fit in the Keyfender® as well as keys with keyless go function. The maximum dimensions for the key are:  9.5 cm long, 3.9 cm wide and 2.1 cm high.

Most people drive to outdoor activities by car and often enough they end up searching for a place to keep their electronic car key safe and dry. Some chose to hide it near the car or leave it at the beach within some towels. Others lock it up to their car. Those options are no good ideas – since leaving the key behind invalidates your insurance.

You are an outdoor and water sports person? You love to be active in all weather conditions, enjoy surfing, go swimming, sailing or biking? You work outdoors, on construction sites or movie productions?  Keyfender® is for all your activities and the life outdoors. 

We are Sylvia and Christoph, two passionate kite surfers, adventurers and are always looking for outdoor experiences. We love to be on the road in our van, go surfing and enjoy the nature. When our daughter Lola was 11 months old, we started touring Southern Europe and North Africa with the first prototype of the Keyfender® in our camper and gathered feedback and experience about what a key case should be capable of. After two years of development, we are now ready to start production with your support.

Our biggest dream is not only to be an active and loving family, but also to run our own little business independently. We proved to be a good team during the last two years of inventing the Keyfender®. It was a road with a lot of ups and downs and coping with some setbacks brought us even closer.

The Keyfender® will be produced by a certificated company in Hamburg. Our assembling and distribution partner is the Elbe workshops for people with disabilities in Hamburg. Due to the short distances we keep the Co2 foot print of our Keyfender® as low as possible.

And here we are now with a well-developed product, wind in our hair and the surfboard aboard. Follow us and the Keyfender® story on our social media channels and support us with the crowdfunding campaign.  Be part of the crowd! Aloha.

We had to produce a lot of 3D-printed prototypes over the last two years before we were satisfied with the size and shape of the Keyfender®. We did a lot of testing and iterated several times before we had the final prototype. We now are able to say: we have the best solution possible ready to produce.

After we tested and developed the prototypes we started developing the injection molds and made them better and more reliable.

Here is what the different iterations, the production mold and the tested devices looked like:  

The pressure mold we use to produce the Keyfender® is ready for production and good for at least the first 25.000 units. We worked on it intensively with an outstanding development partner for the last year.

We made sure we received the best result with our final production model of this first solution for our key case. We also got it tested under the regularities of german institutions and were awarded the IP68 protection class after it was left for one hour in 10m depth. Getting the Keyfender®s back from DEKRA with the certificate was another great day in the Keyfender® story! 

The Keyfender® packaging doesn’t contain any plastic and is made of recyclable material.

Reviews: 

Nice review from Globo Surf here: https://www.globosurfer.com/keyfender-durable-w...

Read more here: https://keyfender.de/

story:
Why do we need you? 

Dear Friends of Douar Samra and Riad Samsara

For the last 20 years, these two houses have changed my life. They brought the sunshine back into my life. And I have been lucky enough to have shared these two exceptional houses with you, my dear friends and travellers.

And then a black cloud descended from far away and has affected our life, mine, yours and ours. This cloud confines us and separates us. It has temporarily deprived us of the moments that we could have shared together in Morocco. But our houses are full of hope. My team is ready for your return.

Even from a distance you can also support us. For this reason, I suggest that you start planning your next stay with us and I am offering you these special prices:

At Riad Samsara in the Marrakech Medina, the price per room of €60/£50 per night, for two persons (including breakfast)

At Douar Samra in the high Atlas Mountains, the price per room of €80/£70 per night, for two persons (including breakfast and dinner)

Please note that both offers are valid for the next 24 months. 

This is an opportunity to project ourselves together into the future and hope. And perceive the rays of the sun again in these dark hours. Thank you my friends for your support over the years and we look forward to welcoming you back to again.

With my sincere good wishes

Jacqueline Brandt

story:
The sneaker with 4-in-1 versatility: providing the benefits of aqua shoes, the comfort of sport shoes, the technical outsole materials of hiking shoes, and the styling of your favorite daily pieces.

In order to cover all our necessities man has designed a lot of different kind of shoes: sneakers, outdoor shoes, hiking shoes, aqua shoes, slippers… However all this footwear is so specific that if we don’t want to have any problem while packing for the next big adventure, we are forced to sacrifice on comfort and convenience.

 

 

 

 

The 3D materials adapt to you, breath and let the water go through, absorbing as little as possible. We have partnered with Cosmo Fabrics, and use their materials and patented treatments, like Agion® and Combat™.

 

 

Cosmo is a revolutionary performance and marketing-based textiles and composites, all done in an environmentally responsible mode and vegan friendly. The diverse product line is designed and styled in the USA, yet either manufactured in their own plants in Southeast Asia or in the USA.

 

 

We Give Away NOW Two Laces ¡Wear Them In The Way You Want!

 

*Please note that these are sample colors and may slightly change

Half Sizes | If you typically are between two sizes, we recommend sizing up for a more relaxed fit or sizing down for a snug fit.

Size Exchanges | Getting the perfect fit can be difficult especially online. It’s our mission that you get the best possible fit with your Tropic's. Send us a message and we’ll be happy to help you out with your exchange!

We're a group of hikers, campers, sailors and surfers, that started TROPIC to create versatile pieces that could span our lives, allowing us to focus more on traveling and less on packing the right gear #carrylesstravelmore.

story: Why are so many toiletry bags poorly designed? We've blown through lots of age old zipper nylon and ziplock bags. Standard bags leak, break apart, mix everything together and makes traveling a hassle!
story_txt: Why are so many toiletry bags poorly designed? We've blown through lots of age old zipper nylon and ziplock bags. Standard bags leak, break apart, mix everything together and makes traveling a hassle!

story:
DESIGN + FEATURES




OUR STORY

We are Y Athletics, and our mission is to simplify your life with thoughtfully designed gear you can fall in love with. To do that, we engineer each product from scratch, with materials and components tailored specifically towards them. By focusing on every single detail, we are able to strike the perfect balance between performance, comfort, and style. We don't make too many products, but whatever we do make screams quality and craftsmanship.

After many months and hundreds of hours in development, we got the formula right for our socks. We are proud to introduce the SilverAir Sock - It's beautiful. It's comfortable. It's odorless. It just works.


Development
This is a brand new fabric. We sourced the finest merino wool from Australia, known for its natural performance and odor-resistant qualities. But wool by itself is not soft enough, so we added acrylic for superior comfort, nylon for durability, and spandex for stretch recoverability. Finally, we blended pure silver on the areas that accumulate the most sweat, which takes the odor-fighting capability of this sock to a whole new level, unlike anything you’ve experienced.

After fabrication comes construction and we iterated until it was just right. We used seamless knitting to create a sock without any stitches and added vent panels that allow airflow to keep your feet cool and comfortable. The sock is beautiful inside and out. After you've worn it a few times, you won’t be able to go back to anything else.


Testing
We've been testing our socks rigorously over the last 9 months. A backer from our first campaign cycled 800 miles for two weeks wearing the same pair of SilverAir socks. A decathlon athlete wore them through his entire race and the socks stayed fresh. And, of course, we wear them every day ourselves. Every test led to improvement until we got them just right. 


Production
This is where you come in. We're still a young brand that's self-funded, and to bring these socks to market, we need to manufacture them at a moderate scale. Help us fund our first production batch of the SilverAir Sock and be the first to receive a pair... your support would mean the world to us.


HOW IT WORKS


WHERE IT'S MADE

We're proud to work with the best manufacturers in the industry. Here's where our socks are made:


COLORS + STYLES

ANKLE SOCKS

CREW SOCKS


MEASUREMENT GUIDE

https://www.yathletics.com/pages/sizing


SHIPPING + DELIVERY

Your reward is expected to ship in November 2016.


HELP US SPREAD THE WORD

We need your help to get the word out, so please help us by telling your friends and family about us. We also give away prototypes to our fans on facebook and twitter from time to time so keep an eye out...


INTERNATIONAL BACKERS

Carrier - We ship to most international countries via FedEx and USPS. While we will ultimately decide your carrier, we will ask you for your preference before we ship out your socks.

Duties & Taxes - Please be aware that all international shipments are subject to duties and taxes by your government and you are responsible for paying that. In certain cases, the carrier (FedEx or USPS) will pre-pay the duties and taxes and bill you later.

story:
Since organizing in 2005, Houston Roller Derby has grown into a league of more than 120 skaters. We have four home teams, an All-Star travel team, a recreational league, and have recently added both Co-Ed and Junior Derby. 

The Houston Roller Derby All-Stars are Houston’s dream team - the league’s most talented and dedicated skaters cherry-picked out of its four home teams. These women train a minimum of three times a week and have played against numerous cities across the U.S. since 2006. They are currently ranked 28th worldwide by the Women's Flat Track Derby Association (WFTDA).

Houston Roller Derby is gearing up for a truly amazing All-Star season this year, but we need your support.

We are training like never before, and with our hard work and your support we will have the opportunity to represent Houston in one of the WFTDA Division One Tournaments this September!

A successful season requires a considerable amount of time, effort, and of course, money.  It takes a lot of Benjamins to send our All-Star skaters all over the nation to represent the 4th largest city in the US. All of this means that we need to raise $$$ and we’re asking for your donations so our skaters can focus on their training.

Our All-Stars are comprised of TWENTY amazing skaters, and here’s a little idea of how much money it takes just ONE skater to travel for an away game:  

--$75+ to buy her a roller derby helmet.

--$120+ to outfit her in our pink and black All-Star uniforms.

--$500 per trip to send her to play out of state.

Not to mention every skater has to have the requisite skates, wheels, bearings, knee pads, elbow pads, wrist guards, mouth guards and more, all of which can add up to over $700 per skater!  

  • Donate ANY amount and you get our undying love and support for all time!
  • Donate $25 and you get two HRD stickers and a koozie!
  • Donate $50 and you get all rewards of previous levels + and an autographed All Star photo!
  • Donate $100 and you get all rewards of previous levels + limited edition All-Star t-shirt!
  • Donate $250 and you get all rewards of previous levels + invite to special happy hour with the whole team upon return from the East Coast Derby Extravaganza (ECDX) held in Feasterville, PA June 28-30, 2013!
  • Donate $500 and you get all rewards of previous levels + a pair of VIP tickets to the bout of your choice!

 

ANYTHING AND EVERYTHING you contribute helps us get one step closer to domination!  We sincerely appreciate all of your continued support and love!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not able to contribute funds but would like to sponsor in kind or volunteer, please write us at info@houstonrollerderby.com. We’d love to hear from you!

Tell your friends!

If you like this cause and want to help, please share this on facebook or twitter.

Thank you for your support! 

Houston Roller Derby

For more information about Houston Roller Derby, visit www.houstonrollerderby.org

Houston Roller Derby is a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization.

story:
Support Slater Mills

Hello lovers of fishing and American business. I'm James Devriendt, President and CEO of Slater Mills Fishing Company, former combat veteran Marine and lifelong angler. Slater Mills is family-owned and employs local artisans in Jewett City, CT to hand craft the finest fishing rods in the country - designed and manufactured in a town where fishing is as deeply rooted in the culture as lunch pails and hard hats. 

Our hand crafted rods are used by Paul Hebert of Wicked Tuna and famous captains Mel True and Butch Finnegan. And by contributing to Slater Mills you and your friends will have the opportunity to go on a private charter with one of these fine captains with your very own custom Slater Mills fishing rod. 


The goal of our Indiegogo campaign and company is clear.  It's to build fine American-Made made fishing rods to spread prosperity through the sport of fishing, whether it be on a charter fishing for big game, or sitting on the end of the dock with simply a bobber, your child and a conversation. And as a backer of Slater Mills, you'll help do just that. Thank you for supporting. 


James Devriendt, CEO
Slater Mills Fishing Company


Donate $25, Go Fishing with Slater Mills on a Private Charter

Want to take you and your friends Tuna Fishing in the deep Atlantic with Paul Hebert from Wicked Tuna? Well, we at Slater Mills want to make that happen as a token of our gratitude. In addition, you'll all receive a custom Slater Mills fishing rod.

When you support Slater Mills with a donation of only $25, you'll be entered to win 1 of 9 half-day private fishing charters with 3 of the best anglers in the country: Paul Hebert from Wicked Tuna (Gloucester, MA), Mel True (Cape Cod, MA) and Butch Finnigan (Space Coast, FL). We're seeking a total of $80,000 to continue to build and market our rods to put them in retail stores across the USA. 100% of the donations go to the people of New England who manufacture our rods and marketing costs. None of the funding will go to the founders of Slater Mills. 

For a pledge of $5,000, $3,500 or $2,500, you can guarantee a charter for you and your friends.

Our Charters

Charter with Paul Hebert from Wicked Tuna in Gloucester, MA

Who: You + 3 of your friends + Paul Herbert and a sea full of tuna
Where: Gloucester, MA
The boat: The Hard Merchandise
The gear: All Slater Mills fishing rods for you to keep. 

What you need to go: 
1. Pledge $25 to Slater Mills for a chance to win. 3 Winners will be selected for 3 separate private tours.
2. Pledge $5,000 to Slater Mills to guarentee this trip for you and 3 friends. Only two of these are available. 


What Your Impact Means to Us


We have big ambitions at Slater Mills and need your help. We are all about two things, the quality of our products and our employees. Our quality is what has brought us to this point. We believe in making a product here in the United States that meets our customers standards without adding a premium price. Secondly, we believe in paying every employee of Slater Mills a living wage. Your contribution will help a handcrafted American-made fishing rod company spread the joy of fishing around the United States while supporting the citizens of this country who make them.

The ownership refuses to take a single penny from the company until it is viable and healthy, which means the employees are taken care of first and foremost … period.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can make a contribution. If you can't we ask that you use the Indiegogo sharing tools to help spread the campaign to your peers. Thank you for your interest in Slater Mills.

Happy Fishing! Sincerely,

James Devriendt, CEO
Slater Mills Fishing Co.


Private Charter Details
Airfare and lodging will be paid by the purchaser. The charter will be scheduled according to your schedule. We'll take you fishing when it's most convenient for you anytime in 2014. The charter with Paul Hebert will take place when Wicked Tuna isn't filming.

story:
My (Bruce's) Journey

  • Returning from a serious leg break in April 2011, at age 51, I balked at my surgeon's comment that I wouldn't run as I did before. Since then, I've participated in 7 triathlons in 2012, a half marathon, one 5K, and 9 triathlons in 2013, placing in the top 3 five times. I was told growing up I could do whatever I wanted to do if I put my mind to it, and that has motivated me all these years. 
  • Now, at age 54, after intense training, I recently qualified to race on behalf of Team USA in Spain in May 2014. A duathlon is a race comprised of running, then biking and running again.  It's an honor and a privilege to go and represent this great country of ours.  USA, USA, USA, USA!!!

What We Need

  • We wanted to let you know where your funds are going in regards to our journey to Spain.  Your funds will be going towards:
  • My flight, Cathy's flight (as she goes to cheer me on!), cost of getting my bike there, our hotel stay during the week of the race, food, inter-country transportation, USA team uniform, and insurance.
  • If we do not reach our goal, any money raised will still go to us via the Indiegogo website, and we are excited about this opportunity to work in tandem with Indiegogo.

The Impact

  • So many of you walked with us through the leg break, praying for us, visiting me in the hospital and at home, and this opportunity is a result of your belief in me all these years.  
  • Many of you have been able to keep track of my race results through Facebook, cheering me on, encouraging me along the way.  
  • I can't tell you how much I look forward to going to Spain, representing all of you... (Los Alamitos HS, college, work, work-out friends, Nashville, church... to name a few) as well as this wonderful country we call "home".

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help!

  • Please, if you would, get the word out and make some noise about our campaign via social media and simply by word of mouth.
  • And remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Words of encouragement to keep going and train hard.  It's not always easy to wake up most mornings at 4:00 a.m. when it's 20 degrees outside (or less!).  But after I do get up and work out, I feel like I've accomplished something to represent the USA to the best of my ability. 

Thank you so much for anything and all that you can do.  We are so grateful.

story:
Hi! My name is Lael Miller. My family and I moved to beautiful Bella Vista, California in 2015 with the dream of building hobbit holes on our 40-acre property and sharing them with guests as a bed & breakfast inn. That dream is only a few months from being a reality. We’ve overcome a lot of challenges to get to this point, and we want to share the last stage of the journey with you. We’re inviting those with a passion for travel, Tolkien, or saving the planet to join us!

Your $250 contribution gives you early access to reserve a free night at our inn before the general public can make reservations. Our rooms will normally rent for $250/night plus a bunch of taxes, so this is both a discount and your best chance to get the room you want on the date you want. The free night is fully transferrable and can be used any time in the next 10 years. We have four rooms, so we will limit the number of participants to 600, allowing us to easily accommodate all of our contributors within the first year of operation.

In addition to providing an amazing experience for our guests, we want to change the way people build homes. Redding and Paradise have lost hundreds of homes in recent years to wildfire, and global warming will only make the problem worse. These structures are impervious to wildfires, hurricanes, or tornadoes, and would suffer minimal damage in an earthquake or flood. They use no fossil fuels, and coupled with our solar panels, have zero net carbon footprint. It’s a style of construction that could revolutionize the way we live in harmony with the planet.

We also want to change the lives of young people in the foster system, so we are converting the inn to a voluntary youth shelter after 10 years of operation. A voluntary youth shelter provides temporary housing for older kids when a traditional foster home is not immediately available. If the child wishes to stay with us, they are allowed to do so indefinitely. Otherwise, their social worker will find them another home. We want to build a place that any kid would love to stay and give them the love, guidance and support that they need. Half of the kids in the foster system will end up homeless at some point when they age out. We want to change that statistic without depending on constant fundraising, so we’re running the business to build an endowment for the future, creating a place for kids that will last long after we are gone. 

We’ve spent almost $300,000 so far - basically our life savings, but we encountered a lot of unexpected difficulties along the way. To finish construction and decorate the rooms, we need to raise the last $60,000. This will allow us to open our doors to our first guests by May, 2021. We would like to raise an additional $25,000 for landscaping improvements, road maintenance and administrative expenses so that these tasks are completed in time for our first guests get the benefits instead of waiting until our revenue stream can cover them. If we don’t reach our funding goal, we will need to delay opening, but we will keep working until we finish the project.

If you can’t visit us in Northern California, we encourage you to find out about foster programs in your area. There are also mentoring programs and aid programs for foster parents who need a little more than the system provides. Finally, please share this campaign either directly on social media or by using the share tools on Indiegogo, especially if you know any Lord of the Rings fans!

story:
SKY AND SAND IS THE SHAPE THAT OUR DREAM HAS TAKEN

 

 

 

We wanted a tool that would allow us to share the charm of this stretch of coastline with the rest of the world in the best way possible... and we believe we've found it!

In Nosara, if you want to enjoy a sunset by the sea, sail with dolphins or snorkel in the most remote beaches you can do it... designed for other types of experiences, with little space and comfort.
Sky and Sand was born specifically to give the best way to enjoy this environment with the most authentic style "pura vida", which means relax, comfort, sharing and joy... all in full respect of the environment.

 

HOW IT WILL BE

 

 


 

 

Sky and Sand is already under construction and will be in the water in July 2021!

We are building Sky and Sand entirely in Costa Rica, in Puntarenas, and we are doing it with local artisans, trying to give our contribution to the economy of the country. 

 

Here is the work in progress from the earliest moments until now

 

 

WHAT WE DO

We want to provide 4 different types of experiences in order to try to diversify and meet people's needs as much as possible

 

 

 

 

 

In addition to these 4 types of experiences, our spirit will always be open to listening to people's desires, to build together tailored experiences.

 

 

WHERE WE GO

The places where our experiences will gravitate all around will be varied and wonderful, here are the main ones

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

RESPECT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT

 

 

This kind of certification will be obtainable only once the catamaran will be complete and the c.s.t. staff will be able to examine the boat and draw up the procedures that we will have to adopt.


However, in the meantime, we will adopt a series of measures for the protection of the environment that will allow us to be immediately sustainable.

 

 

WHO WE ARE

Covid, Covid, Covid... Covid has taken away certainties and programs from us too...but it has also given us opportunities. For example, it gave us the opportunity to completely change our lives and pursue a dream... The dream of being able to live surrounded by an authentic wild nature and atmosphere.

Here we are, living and breathing the air of Costa Rica, of "pura vida".

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU?

 

As you have seen the catamaran is already under construction and will be in the water in July 2021, no matter how this campaign goes.

"So why are you here?"

Simple, because we want to start sharing the values and the mission that this aventura brings. We want to give everyone a chance to start booking this experience at a super affordable price and somehow, due to the trust you are giving us, make you an integral part of our catamaran.

Check out the perks to see how we can help each other out!
story_txt:
SKY AND SAND IS THE SHAPE THAT OUR DREAM HAS TAKEN   We wanted a tool that would allow us to share the charm of this stretch of coastline with the rest of the world in the best way possible... and we believe we've found it!In Nosara, if you want to enjoy a sunset by the sea, sail with dolphins or snorkel in the most remote beaches you can do it... designed for other types of experiences, with little space and comfort.Sky and Sand was born specifically to give the best way to enjoy this environment with the most authentic style "pura vida", which means relax, comfort, sharing and joy... all in full respect of the environment. HOW IT WILL BE    Sky and Sand is already under construction and will be in the water in July 2021!We are building Sky and Sand entirely in Costa Rica, in Puntarenas, and we are doing it with local artisans, trying to give our contribution to the economy of the country.  Here is the work in progress from the earliest moments until now 

 WHAT WE DOWe want to provide 4 different types of experiences in order to try to diversify and meet people's needs as much as possible     In addition to these 4 types of experiences, our spirit will always be open to listening to people's desires, to build together tailored experiences.  WHERE WE GOThe places where our experiences will gravitate all around will be varied and wonderful, here are the main ones       RESPECT FOR THE ENVIRONMENT  This kind of certification will be obtainable only once the catamaran will be complete and the c.s.t. staff will be able to examine the boat and draw up the procedures that we will have to adopt.However, in the meantime, we will adopt a series of measures for the protection of the environment that will allow us to be immediately sustainable.  WHO WE ARECovid, Covid, Covid... Covid has taken away certainties and programs from us too...but it has also given us opportunities. For example, it gave us the opportunity to completely change our lives and pursue a dream... The dream of being able to live surrounded by an authentic wild nature and atmosphere.Here we are, living and breathing the air of Costa Rica, of "pura vida".       WHAT WE WANT FROM YOU? As you have seen the catamaran is already under construction and will be in the water in July 2021, no matter how this campaign goes."So why are you here?"Simple, because we want to start sharing the values and the mission that this aventura brings. We want to give everyone a chance to start booking this experience at a super affordable price and somehow, due to the trust you are giving us, make you an integral part of our catamaran.Check out the perks to see how we can help each other out!

story:
Intro

Hi my name is Philip.K 
I`ve  designed musical instruments, mainly guitar and ukulele.
In 2011, I start to make  small acoustic and electric ukuleles in peanut shape and keep upgrading their design, function and quality up to now.
Our EleUke Peanut has been loved by many musicians  and luckily one Canadian famous indie
pop band named `Walk off the Earth` has played EleUke  Peanut in their music video ` Can't Take My Eyes Off You`. So our  EleUke  Peanut exposed on this video more than 10 million views.

 Mean while, there's  been many Peanut copies moving around online shops, therefore we`ve decided to upgrade  new design as a 2019 version.
Here's New 2019 version  EleUke Peanut.

Specification
- Size                              : Soprano(PE-MH)/Concert(CPE-MH)
- Scale                           : 352mm(Soprano)382mm(Concert)
- Total Length              : Soprano(545mm-21.4in)/Concert(570mm-22.4in)
-  Depth                         : Soprano(34mm-1.3in)/Concert(34mm-1.3in)
- Width                          : Soprano(117mm-4.6in)Concert(125mm-4.8in)
- Fret                              : 13 fret(Soprano)/18 fret(Concert)
- Tuning                         : GCEA standard tuning
- Wood Material          : All Mahogany 
- Head Machine          : Open type
- Head shape               : Slotted
- Nut&Saddle              : Graphite
- Nut width                   : 34mm(1.33in)
- Finger Board             : Scientific wood
- Bridge                         : Rosewood
- Control                       : 1 Volume 1 Tone
- Bluetooth Version  : 4.0
- Battery                       : 2hours recharge/10 hours play
- Gig bag                       : Included
-  Strap                          : Included

You can find peanut EleUke user's manual by clicking here
 

Acoustic Peanut 2019
As you can see, it has small body but has been designed with full resonating for large bass
sound.  It has a good balance both for finger picking, strumming and it`s small size make it possible to put in a backpack or carrier.




Acoustic peanut Specification
- Size                        : Soprano(APE-MH)/Concert(CAPE)
- Scale                      : 352mm(Soprano)/382mm(Concert)
- Total length          : Soprano(545mm-21.4in)/Concert(570mm-22.4in)
- Depth                     : Soprano(62mm-2.4in)/Concert(62mm-2.4in)
- Width                      : Soprano(117mm-4.6in)/Concert(125mm-4.9in)
- Tuning                    : GCEA Standard tuning
- Top board             : Solid Mahogany 
- Side&Back           : Mahogany
- Head Machine    : Open type
- Head Shape         : Slotted
- Nut&Saddle         : Graphite
- Nut width              : 34mm(1.33in)
- Finger Board        : Scientific wood
- Bridge                    : Rosewood
- Gig Bag                 : Included
- Strap                      : Included
Here's Acoustic peanut's sound checking vid
Many people can tell whether the ukulele made well or not by checking  visible things like wood material, instrument setting up,  tuning accuracy or action propriety.
Now What about invisible ukulele's sound then? 
Some reviewers describe ukulele's sound ` sweet, melow, deep, rich` but
all of these expressions look very vague.
We need to see ukulele's sounding process to understand why we feel the sound
good or bad by checking below vid.
You may not feel big sound difference on this vid due to camera Mic performance
limitation so, we tested volume difference using audio spectrum analyzer.


*** This peanut sample of the vid is made of all mahogany plywood but,
your perk will be solid mahogany top with better sound.
You might be interested in checking your own ukuleles with same method.
You can find many audio spectrum analyzer from app market for both Android and iPhone,
just give it a try.
As you can see, our acoustic peanut has approx 11dB volume difference between
sound hole closed and opened with rich amount of bass sound.

Production
Electric Peanut is now under production and Acoustic Peanut will be started from 1st of Mar 2019.
 


Shipping 
All perks will be shipped from Xiamen China after quality check and setting up process. It will be sent via sea freight for big Q'ty or otherwise, via air for small volume shipment.

Perks

story:
Samsara is constructed from natural aluminum, as in the luxury suitcase industry. However, Samsara's price point is hundreds of dollars less than other aluminum suitcases. 

The 6061 and 5052 aluminum alloy we use combines Titanium, Magnesium and Zinc, creating a material that is not only lightweight and durable, but also fireproof. 

The suitcase is manufactured with an anodized coating, which is an electrolytic process that increases the natural oxide layer of the suitcase surface. It provides strength without adding weight, and protects the suitcase from scratches in addition to corrosion and weather damages. The anodized coating also gives the suitcase its color. We offer 2 colors: Natural Silver and Matte Black

Aluminum is endlessly recyclable. It has no limit on the amount of times it can be recycled, and only requires 5% of the total energy needed to create it in the first place. 

 

 

Samsara’s forward-looking creative team collaborated to rethink the essence of travel for the business traveler's needs. When designing this striking piece, we blended classic looks and cutting-edge technology with you in mind, helping you travel smarter. Samsara means ‘continuous movement’, which defines the way of life today. We embraced the understanding that creativity is everywhere, and enabled you to be inspired and creative wherever you are-- with your Samsara.  

 

 

Samsara has everything you need for your trip: packing bags, a toiletries bag, a garment bag, and even a folding gym bag for when you hit the gym while traveling.

 

 

 

Samsara Suitcase is connected to you via mobile app. You’ll instantly get a notification if the suitcase moves away from you. You can also get alerts if it was opened by someone else. The app also controls the LED light inside the suitcase, and monitors the battery percentage.

 

 

 

Co-founders Atara Dzikowski and David Dahan combined a love of design, technological innovation, and the need to solve real-life travel challenges to create Samsara.

Samsara was developed within Atara's design house, Design Boxes, which promotes fresh and innovative design while fostering exceptional new talent. Atara has extensive senior managerial experience in development and public affairs, specializing in the fields of art and design. David is an entrepreneur specializing in tech R&D and software management with an extensive business background, focusing on business development and strategic planning.

Together with their team of designers and engineers, Atara and David succeeded in taking Samsara from vision to product.

Samsara Lead Designer: Or Shachar

story:
My dear friend Balkrishna Tamang's family needs our help.

Bal is an amazing man -- he supports his family and friends as a tourist trekking guide in Nepal. His family's house was destroyed by the Nepal Earthquakes. They are currently living outdoors in makeshift housing in Katmandu -- and as a trekking guide his source of income is severely impacted.

Please help Balk and his community any way you can.

UPDATE: Bal was able to move his wife and son out of the danger zone due to our fundraiser. Bal is back in Katmandu helping the community.

His family's house was destroyed by the Nepal Earthquakes. They are currently living outdoors in makeshift housing in Katmandu -- and as a trekking guide his source of income is severely impacted.Please help Balk and his community any way you can. UPDATE: Bal was able to move his wife and son out of the danger zone due to our fundraiser. Bal is back in Katmandu helping the community.

story:
SegSac: Elevate the way you pack

The SegSac™ is more than just a stuff sack. It's organized adventure in a bag.


Never let the hassle of disorganization slow you down again. With the SegSac™,you will only need to organize your gear once. 

Pack with confidence knowing all your gear will remain exactly as you packed it when you arrive to your destination.

The SegSac™ gives you the peace of mind that you'll spend more time exploring the world and less time searching the depths of your backpack. 

4 internal compartments keep gear individually separated yet together in one place, making the SegSac™ the most simple, practical and organizational stuff sack on the market.


By conveniently separating your gear while on-the-go, you can say goodbye to stuffing dirty socks next to your clean t-shirts or wasting precious time searching for one lost item. 

Travelers and backpackers alike know that surprises should be in what's over the next peak, not what's in their backpack.  

And when every square inch counts? Upgrade to the SegSac™ Compression and save tons of space in your pack!

We all love to explore the world around us and to satisfy our natural curiosities. Whether we are heading out for a day outdoors or an adventure of a lifetime, we all spend time organizing the gear and clothes we'll need.

But why spend so much time packing in a neat and orderly fashion if you can't keep it that way? At home, everything has its place. Why can't a similar system exist for when we travel? The solution is the SegSac™.

Designed around the principal of empowering active people to do more with their time outdoors, the SegSac™ is the do anything / go anywhere stuff sack designed for ruggedness, quality, and performance.

  • 4 Internal Compartments: Keeps gear internally separated, yet still in one place for easy and quick access to what you need. These compartments are sewn to the bottom so that items will not slide around and jump compartments.
  • Ultra-Light Fabric: Super light yet ultra-durable fabric means you get the best quality fabric without being weighed down.
  • Nylon Handle in Back: Allows you to grab your SegSac™ quickly from your bag.
  • Drawstring: Durable drawstring allows you to quickly open or close your SegSac™.
  • Optional Compression Straps: Need every inch you can get when you pack? Four compression straps will ensure your bag is both organizing and space-saving.
  • Available in Multiple Sizes: Available in two sizes: 15 liter capacity and 20 liter capacity for the SegSac™ and the SegSac™ Compress.
  • Water resistant: This stuff sack is NOT a dry bag, but water will conveniently bead off it should it get sprayed.  

People with an active lifestyle know the benefits of being organized - it means more time doing what they love. Fussing in your pack for lost items is time that could have been spent hiking another mile or setting up a campsite before sunset.

It was important to Gobi Gear that we designed a product that not only provided increased organization, but also one that is functional enough to withstand any adventure thrown at it.

Take it on the more demanding trips, like a thru-hike on the Appalachian trail, to the more recreational outings such as a picnic at your local park. Anywhere you go, the SegSac™ is aimed to never let the hassle of disorganization slow you down again.

With two unique products - the SegSac™ and SegSac™ Compress - you can be assured that your gear remains organized throughout your journey.

We invite you to pack with confidence. Each product is specially designed to fityour packing needs.


Instead of taking the place of your trusty backpack, the SegSac™ is designed to go INSIDE other bags. This allows you to use all the gear you are familiar with, but with the added organizational benefits of the SegSac™.

The handle in the back allows for quick and easy access to the SegSac™ from within your backpack. The nylon strings and cord lock allow you to quickly open/close the bag to find the exact item you need. Factor in the ultra-light fabric (making the bag virtually undetectable), and the SegSac™ becomes an ideal addition to your traveling gear.

Don't Let Your Packing Efforts Go to Waste on the Trail

Everyone has their own packing method. We all spend time organizing our gear in a way that we hope will make it easily accessible later on. Yet time and time again, we run into a very familiar scenario: that favorite pair of sunglasses, small flashlight, or matching sock is just not where you left it.

The SegSac™ allows you to pack according to function, taking the guess work out of unpacking. No more digging through your entire bag to find that lucky t-shirt, your items stay exactly how you pack, no matter the journey ahead.

Pack your gear by day, pack it by type, pack however! Either way, your gear will be right where you left it at the end of your journey.

With the help from our backers, we plan to get you out on the trail with the SegSac™ by April 2016, just in time for the Spring hiking season!

As the founder of Gobi Gear and creator of the SegSac™, I was driven by a desire to make getting outdoors easier and less of a hassle. You know that moment, where you have finally made it to the summit or to your campsite, you have been hiking all day, and you feel that exhilarating thrill of a day well accomplished outdoors? I love that feeling!

Then you reach into your backpack to find something, and instead of it being where you expect it to be, it has migrated elsewhere. Now you are wasting time searching through the catacombs of your backpack, looking for that item?

Kinda makes me feel like the time I got boiled trying to body surf shore-break in Hawaii

I found it really frustrating that I had spent all this time packing and planning my trip, and then once actually out there on my journey, I was being slowed by my inability to find something I needed.

Regular stuff sacks didn’t cut it, because they too got loose in my pack. Unless of course I bought a big stuff sack, but that had the same effect as my large backpack – a place to lose things.

Several years ago, before a trip hiking 100 miles through the Himalayan Mountains, I developed the Hoboroll, a segmented stuff sack designed to keep me organized. Over time and through our successful 2014 Kickstarter campaign, the Hoboroll evolved into a really neat stuff-sack that converts to a day-bag.

While the Hoboroll is a perfect bag for traveling, there was still a gap left in the market for an ultralight, minimalist, organizational stuff sack.

So Gobi Gear is going back to it’s roots on this one! Aimed at anyone who wants the most simple, paired down solution to being organized while living out of a backpack, the SegSac™ is it!

The SegSac™ has been in development since 2013, slowly being tested and perfected along the way. What we have here today is a culmination of many outdoor gear junkie’s advice, thoughts, and feedback, all rolled into the very best product we can give to you.

Griffin and I still enjoy traveling the world looking for exotic places to hike. We moved to Bend, Oregon so we could spend as much time as possible outdoors, and enjoy all that this beautiful world has to offer us.

The nylon strings and cord lock allow you to quickly open/close the bag to find the exact item you need. Factor in the ultra-light fabric (making the bag virtually undetectable), and the SegSac™ becomes an ideal addition to your traveling gear.






Don't Let Your Packing Efforts Go to Waste on the Trail
Everyone has their own packing method. We all spend time organizing our gear in a way that we hope will make it easily accessible later on. Yet time and time again, we run into a very familiar scenario: that favorite pair of sunglasses, small flashlight, or matching sock is just not where you left it.
The SegSac™ allows you to pack according to function, taking the guess work out of unpacking. No more digging through your entire bag to find that lucky t-shirt, your items stay exactly how you pack, no matter the journey ahead.
Pack your gear by day, pack it by type, pack however! Either way, your gear will be right where you left it at the end of your journey.




With the help from our backers, we plan to get you out on the trail with the SegSac™ by April 2016, just in time for the Spring hiking season!






As the founder of Gobi Gear and creator of the SegSac™, I was driven by a desire to make getting outdoors easier and less of a hassle. You know that moment, where you have finally made it to the summit or to your campsite, you have been hiking all day, and you feel that exhilarating thrill of a day well accomplished outdoors? I love that feeling!


Then you reach into your backpack to find something, and instead of it being where you expect it to be, it has migrated elsewhere. Now you are wasting time searching through the catacombs of your backpack, looking for that item?
Kinda makes me feel like the time I got boiled trying to body surf shore-break in Hawaii


I found it really frustrating that I had spent all this time packing and planning my trip, and then once actually out there on my journey, I was being slowed by my inability to find something I needed.
Regular stuff sacks didn’t cut it, because they too got loose in my pack. Unless of course I bought a big stuff sack, but that had the same effect as my large backpack – a place to lose things.


Several years ago, before a trip hiking 100 miles through the Himalayan Mountains, I developed the Hoboroll, a segmented stuff sack designed to keep me organized. Over time and through our successful 2014 Kickstarter campaign, the Hoboroll evolved into a really neat stuff-sack that converts to a day-bag.
While the Hoboroll is a perfect bag for traveling, there was still a gap left in the market for an ultralight, minimalist, organizational stuff sack.
So Gobi Gear is going back to it’s roots on this one! Aimed at anyone who wants the most simple, paired down solution to being organized while living out of a backpack, the SegSac™ is it!
The SegSac™ has been in development since 2013, slowly being tested and perfected along the way. What we have here today is a culmination of many outdoor gear junkie’s advice, thoughts, and feedback, all rolled into the very best product we can give to you.


Griffin and I still enjoy traveling the world looking for exotic places to hike. We moved to Bend, Oregon so we could spend as much time as possible outdoors, and enjoy all that this beautiful world has to offer us.

story:
Almost four years ago, The West End businesses came together and purchased the Holiday Lights for Beech Street.  The lights serve as a symbol of the festive community spirit.

It was recently discovered that the West End Lights were destroyed by Hurricane Sandy.  The lights were in storage, and everyone thought they would be functional for this years holiday season.  Upon further inspection by the Fire Marshall and the Commissioner of Public Works, it was discovered that the street lights suffered salt water damage and were deemed a fire hazard.                   

The funding for this project will allow us to purchase Beech Street Holiday Light displays that are representative of Long Beach's spirit and resiliency. 

The West End is an iconic focal point of our city. During the holiday season the lights are a pull for residents and visitors alike. As businesses are already struggling post Sandy, and through the winter season, we as a community NEED to bring the lights to Beech Street. 

Long Beach, and specifically the West End, NEED these lights this season.

WE NEED A MIRACLE ON BEECH!!!

We have received a quote for approximately 10K to replace the lights ... it's a lot, we know. Especially as so many are still not home and many are rebuilding.  But every donation helps. 

We know that this city, the people who live here, and the people who love Long Beach, can make MIRACLES happen.
