story:
TOGETHER WE CAN REDUCE THE RISK OF DROWNING WORLDWIDE

Drowning is one of the leading causes of death worldwide for all age groups.


 

*Donations begin only after our campaign has reached $1M raised. 

 

THE FIRST TRULY PORTABLE AND ULTRA COMPACT LIFE PRESERVER



Self inflating. Reusable. Easy-to-throw.

 


 


 

 



 

SMALL ENOUGH TO CARRY EVERYWHERE

Easily fits into backpacks, glove compartments, or beach bags so you always have peace of mind.


 

INSTANTLY INFLATES ON WATER CONTACT

OneUp becomes a life preserver the second it comes into contact with the water.




 

EASY TO THROW ACCURATELY

OneUp is the perfect size and weight for accurate throws that don’t get blown off course by strong winds or currents.


 

ON-THE-GO SAFETY FOR ANY WATER ACTIVITY



 

ALWAYS HAVE A LIFE PRESERVER READY WHEN YOU NEED IT MOST







 

 

FOR SALTWATER AND FRESHWATER


 

 

FOR ALL AGES AND BODIES

OneUp's open-ring design means its not limited by chest size. Perfect for kids and adults of all sizes up to 330lbs or 110N!


 



 

INCREDIBLY DURABLE MATERIALS

OneUp is built with rugged, built with anti-friction materials. It’s made from TPU, Thermoplastic polyurethane, which means it's got high elasticity, transparency and resistance to oil, grease and abrasion. All materials are approved for boat use.




 

SEE ONEUP IN ACTION

 


 


 

REUSABLE IN UNDER TWO MINUTES

To fold the floatation up and put it back into the container will take around a minute and 30 seconds. 



 

WHAT COMES WITH YOUR PRE-ORDER


 

Depending on the perk you select, you will receive: 

At least 1 OneUp life preservation device
At least one carabiner clip
At least one waterproof case
At least two OneUp identifying stickers


 

LIFE-SAVING TECHNOLOGY



 

OUR STORY



We are a small team of water-loving individuals. We have strong experience in water activities and sports. More importantly, we have strong experience in business, production, and manufacturing.

Since our company’s creation in 2015, we’ve worked hand-in-hand with world-wide organizations (like the Red Cross) and collected early innovation awards.

Our main goal is to spread awareness and education the world on the importance and severity of water safety. About 42 people worldwide drown every hour. We want to reduce that number.We’ve decided to crowdfund for a few key reasons:

  • We want to spread our message and awareness as quickly as possible. Selling OneUp first on a globally recognized platform is a major step in reducing the number of drownings.
  • We want to get OneUp in your hands as quickly as possible for as low a price as possible. Crowdfunding allows us to do that.
  • Finally, Crowdfunding is all about you, the audience. Through crowdfunding, we’re able to communicate with you directly, understand your needs from this product, and get your feedback on OneUp.

We can’t wait to get this product in your hands.



 

FROM EARLY CONCEPTS TO PRODUCTION



 

IN YOUR HANDS AND BOATS SOON



 

SHIPPING



We are able to ship worldwide. VAT and GST not included. Please see reward details for the shipping cost that applies to you.
 


We plan to ship the product in July of 2018. Actual ship dates may vary. We will keep you notified of your product ship date.
 


By backing now you'll be one of the very first to hold his or her own OneUp. You'll be an early piece in our movement to lessen the number of drownings a year. You'll also be receiving exclusive discounts that we'll never be offering again.
 

 


 

SPREAD AWARENESS
SHARE ONEUP WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY









 

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

 

What is it? It's is an incredibly-portable personal floatation device that inflates when in contact with water.
Who created it? Saul de León Arteta, CEO & Founder. Geographer and Surfer. He has spent his entire life surrounded by sea.
Why should we use it? 372,000 people die from drownings every year. This is almost 50 people every hour. You should use it to make a difference in these lives lost. 
How much does it cost?  OneUp retails for $99, but you can pre-order now for just $59.
Where can we buy it? Right here on Indiegogo!
What do we get when we order? Your Oneup, an impermeable case to protect it, a karabiner and two stickers.
Why are you crowdfunding? We need to get OneUp in front of as many people as possible in order to make the biggest difference in reducing drownings. 

 

What features are available? OneUp is a standard offering. 
What colors do you offer? As of now, the OneUp case comes in black only and the floatation element is florescent yellow.
What sizes do you offer? OneUp is one-size fits all.
Is it comfortable / attractive / discreet? It is discreet and easy to be used.
Which option is best for me? There is only one option for the product. Please select the number of units you find most useful for you: 1, 2, 5, or 10. 


What is the uniqueness of the technology? The is the first truly portable, instant-inflating life preserver. 
What are the dimensions and weight? OneUp is 6.8 inches long and weighs just 13 oz.
How does it work? OneUp is designed around a salt pod and CO2 inflation with a sensor that is used in aeronautical and naval security. Once in contact with enough water, the salt pod dissolves. Once dissolved, a spring is released to activate the opening of the CO2 bottle causing inflation. If there’s not enough water to dissolve the salt pod, then it won’t inflate.
What kind of sensors are you using?  Sensors that is used in aeronautical and naval security. 
Will there be updates to it in the future? OneUp is a hardware product; if updates are made, you would need to purchase a new unit. 
What is it made from? The device is rugged, built with anti-friction materials. It’s made from TPU, Thermoplastic polyurethane (benefits including elasticity, transparency and resistance to oil, grease and abrasion).
How long does it take to inflate and reset to be reused?  The whole process takes around two second to inflate. To fold the floatation up and put it back into the container will take around a minute and 30 seconds.
Is OneUp Reusable? Yes, it can be reused as many times as you’d like! You’ll simply need to switch out the salt pod and the CO2 cartridge after each use.

 


How do I set it up? OneUp is ready to go. Simply throw into or hold in water for inflation.
Is it reusable?  Yes, it can be reused as many times as you’d like! You’ll simply need to switch out the salt pod and the CO2 cartridge after each use.
How long does OneUp last? OneUp should be replaced every four years. Salt pod should be replaced every two years.
Should I worry about temperature?  Keep away from pointed objects and high temperatures (120,2 F)
Is it dishwasher safe / machine washable? No. OneUp inflates on water contact. 
Does it have an expiry date? It is highly recommended buy a new OneUp after four years

 

What are the recommend ages? We recommend owners be 14 years old and above.
Where can I use it? You can take OneUp with you anywhere and everywhere. Beaches, rives, lakes, boats...and if fits perfectly in bags, backpacks, cars, etc.
Is it safe? Yes. However, as there is CO2 in the canister, please Keep away from pointed objects and high temperatures (120,2 F) to ensure. 
What certifications do you have? MSDS and RFESS, lifeguard approved, and additional certifications pending.
How durable is it? We don't guarantee its efficacy after four years of being purchased it.
Is it for saltwater or freshwater?​ OneUp can be used in any kind of water (salt or fresh).

 

When does shipping begin? Shipping will begin one month and a half after the crowdfunding is finished.
When can we expect it to reach our doorsteps? Between 0 and 45 days after the shipping begins.
Where does it ship? Worldwide. 
How much is shipping? Shipping costs vary per perk and shipping destination. Shipping is free for U.S. addresses. 
I'm interested in a distribution partnership. Please contact us at info@oneupsaves.com
Do I have to pay VAT / GST?

VAT and GST not included in your order. You may have to pay VAT/GST. 

 

Is there a warranty? Your OneUp order comes with a two-year warranty. 
What is your refund policy? Refunds are processed on a case-by-case basis; at some point we will need to lock refunds in order to go into production & shipment. We will not be able to refund orders once they've shipped. 
What is your return / exchange policy? If you received your product and you aren't satisfied, you may exchange it for a new one within 30 days, less shipping & handling fees.
How do I choose more than one reward?  To get more than one perk, please make a new contribution for each perk.
How can I check the status of my pre-order? By pre-ordering through Indiegogo, you automatically have an account created. Log back into Indiegogo using the email you pre-ordered, to verify your information.
Why do I have to wait longer than usual? This is not just pre-orders: You're helping to build the device, and we need to know how many to make before we can start production. This is the first of its kind, and you'll be glad you waited. We will send you updates while we work to produce the first batch.
If I have other questions, who should I contact?
  • For press inquires: oneup@tandemcomms.com
  • For investment inquiries: contact@oneupsaves.com
  • For customer support questions: support@oneupsaves.com

campaign_city: Las Palmas De Gran Canaria, Spain

story:
Hi guys. As most of you probably know, Mark and I were lucky enough to go to Nepal last year to trek to Everest base camp.

Unfortunately the earthquakes that hit Nepal this year have hurt many of the friends we made there. They are mostly from a region west of Kathmandu called Gorkha, which as you might have seen was the epicentre of the first quake. 

The damage was pretty catastrophic. 90% of the buildings in the region were destroyed or seriously damaged. 43 employees of the company we trekked with have lost their homes. 35 schools were destroyed. The almost complete shutdown of the tourist industry meant the overwhelming majority have been out of work for almost 4 months. And that doesn't even mention the 64 loved ones that were killed and injured. For much of the last 3 months our friends and many others have been living in tents and surviving off charity handouts. This is not the beautiful Nepal we saw and fell in love with.

We thought we'd try and raise a bit of cash for them, so in the name of charity (and never having to do another leg day) we're looking to bike 250 miles from Manchester to Edinburgh. I hope I don't need to point out that this is a pretty massive mission, particularly given that one of us was in hospital having lung surgery 3 months ago! We're hoping to make it in 3 days, and promise to upload pics of every beautiful view, impressive sight, and emotional breakdown on the way.

We'd really appreciate it if you would consider donating. The money is going in part directly to the bank accounts of some of our friends there who've lost their homes, and in part to a charity called Sambhav Nepal. Sambhav means 'it's possible' in Nepalese. The charity was set up by the CEO of the trekking company we went with to improve the schools and education in Gorkha, although currently they are more focussed on just enabling the community to get back on its feet. In the 2 months after the earthquake they distributed almost 4000 aluminium sheets and 27,000 kg of rice to those in need. But much more is required.

If anyone wants more information on how the money will be used, please go to www.sambhavnepal.org to see details of their educational projects and ongoing relief work. We particularly recommend the videos. And if anyone has any further questions about where the money is going, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us.
story_txt: Hi guys. As most of you probably know, Mark and I were lucky enough to go to Nepal last year to trek to Everest base camp.Unfortunately the earthquakes that hit Nepal this year have hurt many of the friends we made there. They are mostly from a region west of Kathmandu called Gorkha, which as you might have seen was the epicentre of the first quake. The damage was pretty catastrophic. 90% of the buildings in the region were destroyed or seriously damaged. 43 employees of the company we trekked with have lost their homes. 35 schools were destroyed. The almost complete shutdown of the tourist industry meant the overwhelming majority have been out of work for almost 4 months. And that doesn't even mention the 64 loved ones that were killed and injured. For much of the last 3 months our friends and many others have been living in tents and surviving off charity handouts. This is not the beautiful Nepal we saw and fell in love with.We thought we'd try and raise a bit of cash for them, so in the name of charity (and never having to do another leg day) we're looking to bike 250 miles from Manchester to Edinburgh. I hope I don't need to point out that this is a pretty massive mission, particularly given that one of us was in hospital having lung surgery 3 months ago! We're hoping to make it in 3 days, and promise to upload pics of every beautiful view, impressive sight, and emotional breakdown on the way.We'd really appreciate it if you would consider donating. The money is going in part directly to the bank accounts of some of our friends there who've lost their homes, and in part to a charity called Sambhav Nepal. Sambhav means 'it's possible' in Nepalese. The charity was set up by the CEO of the trekking company we went with to improve the schools and education in Gorkha, although currently they are more focussed on just enabling the community to get back on its feet. In the 2 months after the earthquake they distributed almost 4000 aluminium sheets and 27,000 kg of rice to those in need. But much more is required.If anyone wants more information on how the money will be used, please go to www.sambhavnepal.org to see details of their educational projects and ongoing relief work. We particularly recommend the videos. And if anyone has any further questions about where the money is going, please don't hesitate to get in touch with us.

story:
Honoring "Joepa" Starts With You -- and Brooklyn

From a playground called Flatbush to an uninterrupted valley framed by the Allegheny Mountains of rural Pennsylvania, the life of Joseph Vincent Paterno seems perfectly formed by the physical landscapes that surrounded him. Rough and tumble.  Reaching and vulnerable.  Inspiring and embracing. 


They say fate is the mother of destiny, but it was Paterno's unshakeable belief in family, God, work and education -- instilled by his parents -- that made him "Joepa" -- a character he could never have imagined becoming as he clutched his stickball bat, swinging for the third sewer cover on the streets of Brooklyn.

"Joe's Bench" is a community-based effort focusing on honoring Joseph V. Paterno with a Zenos Frudakis commissioned sculpture and hour-long documentary, "The People's Joe," -- the latter detailing the efforts behind "Joe's Bench" and Joe Paterno's life by the EMMY-nominated producers of "The Joe We Know" and "365 Days".  

These efforts reflect a desire to capture the essence of Paterno in film and form while memories are fresh, and the record of his life can be recognized by those who truly loved him.

We have undertaken this project for FOUR SIMPLE REASONS:

* Joe Paterno's legacy is important to Penn Staters and State College.
* In an effort to galvanize those who admired Joe in life, we feel there is no time like the present to honor Joe.
* By getting involved, you can become a part of ensuring a proper tribute to Joe Paterno is realized. 
* We love this man and what he stood for.



The "Joe's Bench" team is growing daily. This effort welcomes every kind of support imaginable.  It starts with Indiegogo and an overall goal of $500,000 for the overall project.  

CURRENT TEAM MEMBERS

Our team is growing and led by a lot of great people.  One of the first to join was Honorary Committee Member, Franco Harris (PSU '72).  Franco's unique understanding of Joe Paterno's legacy, and his belief in this project, are why we also feel the way we do.  No doubt, we are happy to have him helping us meet our goals.  And like everything he does, he will see it through until our goals are reached.

There are also many others who are helping, including nine Penn State students who are working hard all summer on every aspect of this project.  And there is even an Indiegogo Penn State Alum working on this!!

What We Need & What You Get

This isn't just any tribute, but the first full-scale tribute effort.  The work of Zenos Frudakis is internationally known and you can learn more about his amazing work here: www.zenosfrudakis.com. 

(Above: Zenos Frudakis and Arnold Palmer with Frudakis commissioned statue of Palmer in 2010.)

A clip of Zenos visiting State College to discuss the statue is below.  The film will be distributed via every digital platform available.  Documenting this historic time in our history and telling the story of the man we knew as "Joepa" should not be left to anyone else to achieve and/or define. 

As Franco put it, it is our job to make sure we honor him by sharing who Joe was with future generations.

  • Therefore, we are seeking $500,000 to commission the bench, create media to support the effort and to manage the project during the next 16 months. We hope to raise AT LEAST $250,000 during this campaign!


  • Our "perks" are incredibly cool and help underscore how incredibly cool you are for joining the team.
  • Every penny of your donation will go to these tributes: commissioning  and installing "Joe's Bench," insuring the bench, endowment to maintain the bench, and production and distribution of the film, "The People's Joe".

It's Our Turn to Make a Difference

The very fact we are paying tribute to Joseph Vincent Paterno is important. Why? 

We've heard from the minority for three years -- how we couldn't and shouldn't honor this town, this man, this school. Well...this is our town, our school, our coach.  And you know what that means?  Of course you do.  We know better.  And it is our turn to make an impact.  To show we care. To rise and rally on behalf of someone who made life better for thousands.

Our team also includes eight Penn State student interns, Penn State Football Lettermen and alumni, State College residents and others who will spend the summer helping make this project a reality. Not because we don't care about anything else, but because we think it is entirely possible to respect many things in our history.  At the same time, we can pay long overdue homage to someone we believe deserves better than he's gotten.

$1 = Your Name in Joe's Film*

*We're not kidding. 

A $1 donation will get your name in the end credits of the movie.  And who doesn't want their name in a movie?  Of course, if you can donate more, we have more to share!  And that's what it's all about. 

$5+ = A Statue That Will Last, Your Name in Joe's Film and Something to Remind You of Your Contribution. 

  • So click to donate now and join our team. 
  • Once you have donated, use the Indiegogo "share" tools!  They're so easy to use that our interns don't have to explain them to older team members!

That's all there is to it. 

Welcome aboard.

story:
My name is Emily Hanaway.  I am 17 years old.  I play indoor and sand volleyball.  This year my indoor team qualified for the USA Volleyball Junior Nationals in Minneapolis, Minnesota.  In addition, I qualified with my pick up sand partner for the USAV High Performance Sand Volleyball Tournament in Hermosa Beach July 18-20, 2014 and I qualified with my regular sand partner for the West Coast AAU Sand Volleyball Junior Olympics, July 26-27, 2014.  

Since I made the Lone Star Region High Performance Team, my training and uniforms are free, but I have to raise funds for air fare, room and board for 9 days in Hermosa Beach, California.  

The USAV High Performance Team and Championships are a pipeline for Olympic sand volleyball.  It is an honor to earn a spot on this team.  

If you donate to this fund, I will keep you updated on my journey by sharing a newsletter with pictures and updates from Hermosa Beach.  

These funds will specifically go toward air fare to and from Hermosa Beach, California, dates July 17-July 28 and toward room and board costs during my competition.  

Please include your email if you would like to receive updates from me. 

Thank you for your consideration,

Emily Hanaway

volleyballgirl.em@gmail.com

www.emilyhanaway.com

story:
INTRODUCING USTER

USTER offers an effective solution to house deep daily cleaning. With multi-functional UV lights, 6 UVC + 10 UVA lights give you a neat and tidy life.

WHY DO WE NEED IT?

FEATURES

VERSATILE with 

LARGE AREA of STERILIZING

Uster is equipped with 16 disinfectants, with a direct irradiation area of ​​0.25 square meters.  As a portable disinfection lamp, it can disinfect 1 pair of shoes, a piece of clothing, a doll, and an air conditioner at a time.   So, clean up everything you have touched and anything you might touch on a regular basis.

These common items in life are proven to contain many bacterias.

 

HOW IT WORKS

Wavelengths between 260-280nm are considered UV-C which is widely used in today's cleaning industry. (Uster has a wavelength between 265-285nm).

FOR THOSE WHO NEED USTER

3 MODES OF USE

(1) Manual mode------gives you full-handed control to clean up every spot. And because it's light and small, your cleansing has become never easier before.

(2)Stand up mode------You may also pop out the "foot" on the side to use the Stand-up mode to scan flat objects within a period of time that you set up.

(3)Hang-up mode------For your wardrobe,  the Hang-up mode always does a great job for you. Every Uster UV lamp comes with a suspension lanyard to allow it hung in your wardrobe.

THREE SIMPLE STEPS

It only takes three simple steps to provide you a nice and clean space.

 

SUFFICIENT POWER

There's no need to use Uster with wires. The 2000mAh built-in battery stores sufficient electricity for 10 UV lights working simultaneously and makes one charge enough for a week of regular use.

Human Protection

Ultraviolet is an extremely powerful type of cleansing beam, but it also has potential danger if you're exposed to it for too long. However, Uster won't do that to you. With a built-in gravity sensor, the product will automatically shut down when you flip it over, to protect you from injury of skin and eye.

 

SMALLER, SLIMER, SMATER

Exaggeration is not our style. What we offer is a useful UV lamp with a slim shape, a potable size, and lightweight.

FLASH INDICATOR

The flash circle around the power button is a smart indicator that tells the battery status. You always know how your Uster is doing, and when to give it some juice.

COMPARE THE FACTS

SPECIFICATION

 

ANYTIME, ANYWHERE

PRE-ORDER AND SAVE MORE

WE WILL SHIP SOON

We know you gonna need it anxiously, we will ship it as soon as the campaign ended!

LABORATORY TEST REPORT

We sent our product to the government pointed lab to do the testment, proving it works for the germs within  a short time.

Follow us on

story:
The City of Medicine Hat is a quiet, friendly and beautiful little City located in the middle of two major tourist destinations, Calgary and Saskatchewan and is located at the very Southern tip of the Province of Alberta, Canada bordering U.S. Western Montana and having the longest sunshine hours in all of Canada hence the - “Sunniest City”

Yusuf Ali has identified the family entertainment and attraction industry as his primary interest and to that end has focused his time and effort on developing a truly iconic family entertainment facility that will comprise of an all-season Waterpark Resort, Casino Hotel and Conference Centre with a specially branded (870,000 sq. ft.) Outlet Mall as well as a Canlan Ice Sports www.icesports.com multi-purpose sports and entertainment facilities to be developed in the City of Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Entertainment has become a buzzword of the new millennium and Yusuf Ali, has observed, “People are not just interested in buying novelty items or memorabilia’s. They want an experience, adding that the key to providing a successful experience are authenticity, fun and participation.”

This exciting project development is expected to create approximately 2,600 new (full-time and part-time) jobs in the areas of construction, hotel and hospitality, restaurants, gaming and entertainment just to name a few.

Our project proposal to date has received wide-support and encouragement from the various levels of Government as well as interest from prospective investors, professional developers, several financial institutions and most recently a strategic partnership alliance with a major Hollywood Studio that would become the official flagship brand that would anchor our exciting and iconic-tourist destination in Medicine Hat.

While we’re very pleased with our project milestones as well as the tremendous support and encouragement from our facebook fans https://www.facebook.com/#!/XtremeTyphoonWaterparkResortCasinoHotel, there’s still quite a bit of grounds to be cover that would help in turning this dream into a reality, and which we hope we’ll be able to achieve by garnering the much needed support through the Indiegogo website.

The funds being sort at this time would not only cover our legal cost, but would also help to cover and produce a comprehensive feasibility study that would determine whether the attraction concept can be successfully implemented in the City of Medicine Hat; to ascertain the type, quantity and quality of the components that should be provided in light of what the current economic climate and risk profile will allow; to weigh the level of development funds required for amenities and whether these costs are justified; to develop a master plan for the site which would ascertain the best usage of the available land and to provide a viable financial operating model.

Ms. Catherine Farnell, Partner with the law firm Witten LLP www.wittenlaw.com has express interest in taking on the mammoth responsibility of spear-heading this large scale development which will include, but not limited to negotiations with various private equity partners/investors, financial institutions, M&A (Merger and Acquisition), contract negotiations and brand licensing agreement.

In return for your financial support your name would be added and proudly displayed on our “VisionMaker’s Plague” inside of our future resort and you would also be eligible for a contribution of $100.00 the following perks for one (1) year once the park and resort is open.

.   50% discount on Xtreme Typhoon Waterpark season passes

.   50% discount on Retail Shopping and Dining with participating retailers and restaurants

.   50% discount on Hotel Stay and accommodations (subject to seasonal restrictions) to a maximum of 2 guests

Should our goal not be reached, we would donate a portion of these funds to The Medicine Hat Regional Hospital.

story:
Who Am I?

                    


My name is Eva and I am One Girl Around the World. I am 29 years old, originally from Portugal and I live in London. I used to sail in Portugal for regional and national competitions when I was a teenager, I have never been so healthy! 

I love to travel and I make it my goal in life to conquer as much territory as I can and challenge myself everywhere I go.  

I grew up in Ivory Coast, I travelled around north America alone in a rented car, I did South East Asia alone as a backpacker and I've worked in Brazil. 

It is my dream to travel and take on challenges, so.. I applied for the Clipper Round The World Race 2015 - 2016 and I was accepted! Which means now I need the money to make it become a reality and for that I need your help. Not only to sponsor the race and the costs involved but also to help me raise money for the charity I am supporting with this adventure across the ocean. 


What is the Clipper Race?

Picture, content: All rights reserved to: http://www.clipperroundtheworld.com

This is the only race in the world where the organisers supply the fleet of twelve identical, 70-foot, stripped down racing yachts – each sponsored by a brand – and manned with a fully-qualified skipper, employed to lead the crews safely around the globe.

It’s where anyone from any background, culture or age (over 18s) can compete. It’s an experience that will change people’s lives. 

The sea does not distinguish between Olympians and normal citizens, the crews need to be ready to face exactly the same challenges as those experienced by the pro racer.

And, when they return from the biggest challenge they have ever faced, the crews bring home countless lessons with them. The importance of teamwork and the importance of respect. Of giving more than you take. Of learning what your body is capable of. An appreciation of cultures, religions, lifestyles and attitudes that connect with communities right around the globe.

Because of its amateur status and varied crew profile, don’t for a moment consider this to be some sort of easy option. The crews have to work hard to become winners and it’s not unusual that boats might finish within minutes of each other after three weeks and 3,000 miles of ocean racing.

Pictures, content: All rights reserved to: http://www.clipperroundtheworld.com


My Challenge: South Africa - Australia


                              


Back on board with tales of diving with great whites, safaris and sampling the best of Stellenbosch, the challenging Southern Ocean will be my home and my challenge for three weeks.


About the chosen charity

                                   

Who we are |

Reignite is a registered charity in England & Wales established in 2012.

It was founded with the aim of lifting rural African communities from poverty by using a multisectorial approach and valuing local human and natural resources.

Where are we based |

We have a network of volunteers based in Bristol and London; but our operations office is in a small village situated in the northwestern region of Cameroon, called Bambui. This is where we develop the majority of our projects and where our small team of 5 people operates from.

Why Bambui |

Bambui is a small village with approximately 10,000 inhabitants, which has risen to 20,000 in the last two years due to the construction of a University.

Despite enjoying an atmosphere of peace and slight economic growth, this region is still considered to be the 2nd poorest one in the country with 30% of its population still living with less than $1 a day.

Why are we different |

We don't tackle one problem at a time; instead we work very closely with the community in developing an integrated long-term strategy for the general improvement of their living conditions. 

For that reason we have projects in a varied range of areas, which tackle social, health, environmental and financial problems simultaneously:

•  Water & Sanitation, Hygiene & Public Health;

•  Skills development & Education;

•  Micro-finance;

•  Food & Agriculture;

•  Environment, Biodiversity & Climate change adaptation; and

•  Promotion of Cultural Heritage.

How do we do it |

We work through local partner organisations in order to provide support to project implementation. These local partners are usually non-governmental organisations, local government departments, small private companies and community based organisations.

We provide:

·  Bespoke solutions using the local resources available, and are able to offer financial support by applying for international grants, providing micro credit and develop projects with revolving funds; and,

·  Training and technical advice, as well as overall assistance with capacity building, planning, budgeting and institutional development.

We also act as a cooperation platform, through which we seek to partner with international organisations available to link up with local partners.  

Why do WE need YOU to help Eva |

With the £3,000 that Eva is hoping to raise for us we can build 6 latrines – one in 6 out of the 18 existing schools. This means that:

·  1,700 children will have access to proper sanitation facilities for the very first time; and,

·  More than 10,000 people will enjoy from the health benefits that such technology will bring.

This is what latrines look like today in Bambui schools:


And this is what we want to achieve:

[Please note: Reignite decided to adopt this technology following the recommendations of an EWB-UK Sanitary Engineer that spend 3 months working with us in Bambui. All the materials needed to build this infrastructure are being sold in the local market and technicians have been trained on how to build it]

Now all we and the Bambui Community need, is just a little bit of extra help to make it happen.

Please help Eva help us!


How can you help?


I am asking for £15.000, which is for:

  1. £5000 for training (This is compulsory and any crew member that participates has to do an intense training course before competing in either UK or Australia)
  2. £5.900 for taking part on Leg 3 of this competition (South Africa to Western Australia)
  3. £500 for insurance (This is compulsory and due to the high risk of this challenge it is extremely necessary) 
  4. £600 for flights from London to South Africa and from Australia - not enough, I am hoping to get sponsorship from a travel agent / representative 

Making a total of £12,000 to take part on the race 

and £3000 for Reignite Action For Development Projects


BUT....

IF I DO reach my target and you support me on more then one race, which means £5000 extra for each leg of the race and £45.000 to become a circumnavigator (Race around the world for 11 months) then I shall take on the challenge of extra races and as many as possible depending on your donations! with the guarantee that 20% will always go to Reignite. 

IF I DON´T reach my target and since this is a flexible campaign then I will give 20% of all donations to the charity and find the remaining funds to achieve my goal.


What You Get


£1 = You are a sponsor

  • You will be an official sponsor for this project and I will be forever grateful. 


£10 = A thank you

  • You will receive a public thank you on One Girl Around the World page and twitter. Please provide personal details (Like the One Girl Around the World page and tell me your name). You will also receive a personalised electronic postcard. 


£25 = Merchandise w/ Kids Art

  • As a thank you, you will receive a OGATW Tote Bag with Bambui kids art printed and a personal thank you note.


£100  = Merchandising and Postcard

  • You will receive OGATW Tote Bag and T-Shirt with Bambui kids art printed and a Postcard from South Africa!!


£300  = Message in the bottle and more

  • OGATW Merchandise (Tote Bag + T-Shirt) with Bambui kids art printed with a  thank you note on the post, a postcard from South Africa and one from Australia and a message in bottle released in the ocean with your personal message from the country of your choice, SA or OZ?


£1000  = Join me for an event of a lifetime

  • Aside from a big thank you and a free hug and all the perks above, I would like you to be my guest for the departure ceremony of the race in London and also in South Africa and Australia if logistically possible. 

£5000  = Marketing and publicity

  • Mainly for companies and anyone who want to share their projects, I will wear gear with your logo on board and while on competition. This is an event with a great amount of exposure. Rules apply, please ask. 


£15000  = I will make a tattoo chosen by you!

  • You are my heroes!! I will tattoo something of your choose. the only rule is to have the theme: One Girl Around the World! Other then that I will ask everyone to send ideas for a Tattoo to my OGATW page on Facebook and the tattoo that gets the most votes wins!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute and you believe in my project and what I stand for then you can help like this:

  • Like and share One Girl Around the World Facebook page and all other social networks
  • Share the campaign and idea with your friends
  • Ask your friends, family and co-workers to contribute
  • Send me an email with ideas / comments / Sponsors to contact etc
  • Buy merchandising! Store coming soon. 


And this is it! This race will change my life, it is a dream I have and I hope you help me achieve it. Not only will you help me achieve something remarkable but also help a charity that helps communities grow and develop. You will make a difference with any contribution. Free hugs are also accepted as a method of currency!

Find us at...

OGATW Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/onegirlaroundtheworld

OGATW Twitter: https://twitter.com/aroundworldgirl

#girlsailsaroundtheworld 

Email: onegirlaroundtheworld@gmail.com

Reignite: https://www.facebook.com/ReigniteAction

Information about the race: http://www.clipperroundtheworld.com
story_txt:
Who Am I?                    My name is Eva and I am One Girl Around the World. I am 29 years old, originally from Portugal and I live in London. I used to sail in Portugal for regional and national competitions when I was a teenager, I have never been so healthy! I love to travel and I make it my goal in life to conquer as much territory as I can and challenge myself everywhere I go.  I grew up in Ivory Coast, I travelled around north America alone in a rented car, I did South East Asia alone as a backpacker and I've worked in Brazil. It is my dream to travel and take on challenges, so.. I applied for the Clipper Round The World Race 2015 - 2016 and I was accepted! Which means now I need the money to make it become a reality and for that I need your help. Not only to sponsor the race and the costs involved but also to help me raise money for the charity I am supporting with this adventure across the ocean. What is the Clipper Race?Picture, content: All rights reserved to: http://www.clipperroundtheworld.com
This is the only race in the world where the organisers supply the fleet of twelve identical, 70-foot, stripped down racing yachts – each sponsored by a brand – and manned with a fully-qualified skipper, employed to lead the crews safely around the globe.It’s where anyone from any background, culture or age (over 18s) can compete. It’s an experience that will change people’s lives. The sea does not distinguish between Olympians and normal citizens, the crews need to be ready to face exactly the same challenges as those experienced by the pro racer.And, when they return from the biggest challenge they have ever faced, the crews bring home countless lessons with them. The importance of teamwork and the importance of respect. Of giving more than you take. Of learning what your body is capable of. An appreciation of cultures, religions, lifestyles and attitudes that connect with communities right around the globe.Because of its amateur status and varied crew profile, don’t for a moment consider this to be some sort of easy option. The crews have to work hard to become winners and it’s not unusual that boats might finish within minutes of each other after three weeks and 3,000 miles of ocean racing.Pictures, content: All rights reserved to: http://www.clipperroundtheworld.com
My Challenge: South Africa - Australia                              Back on board with tales of diving with great whites, safaris and sampling the best of Stellenbosch, the challenging Southern Ocean will be my home and my challenge for three weeks.About the chosen charity                                   Who we are |
Reignite is a registered charity
in England & Wales established in 2012. 
It was founded with the aim of
lifting rural African communities from poverty by using a multisectorial
approach and valuing local human and natural resources. 
Where are we based |
We have a network of volunteers
based in Bristol and London; but our operations office is in a small village
situated in the northwestern region of Cameroon, called Bambui.
This is where we develop the majority of our projects and where our small team
of 5 people operates from.
Why Bambui |
Bambui is a small village with approximately
10,000 inhabitants, which has risen to 20,000 in the last two years due to the
construction of a University.
Despite enjoying an atmosphere of peace
and slight economic growth, this region is still considered to be the 2nd
poorest one in the country with 30% of its population still living with less
than $1 a day. 
Why are we different |
We don't tackle one problem at a time;
instead we work very closely with the community in developing an integrated
long-term strategy for the general improvement of their living conditions.  
For that reason we have projects in a
varied range of areas, which tackle social, health, environmental and financial
problems simultaneously: 
•  Water & Sanitation, Hygiene &
Public Health;
•  Skills development & Education;
•  Micro-finance;
•  Food & Agriculture;
•  Environment, Biodiversity &
Climate change adaptation; and
•  Promotion of Cultural Heritage.
How do we do it |
We work through local partner
organisations in order to provide support to project implementation. These
local partners are usually non-governmental organisations, local government
departments, small private companies and community based organisations. 
We provide:
· 
Bespoke solutions
using the local resources available, and are able to offer financial support by
applying for international grants, providing micro credit and develop projects
with revolving funds; and,
· 
Training and
technical advice, as well as overall assistance with capacity building,
planning, budgeting and institutional development.
We also act as a cooperation platform,
through which we seek to partner with international organisations available to
link up with local partners.  
Why do WE need YOU to help Eva |
With the £3,000 that Eva is hoping to
raise for us we can build 6 latrines – one in 6 out of the 18 existing schools.
This means that:
· 
1,700 children will
have access to proper sanitation facilities for the very first time; and,
· 
More than 10,000
people will enjoy from the health benefits that such technology will bring. 
This is what latrines look like today in
Bambui schools:

And this is what we want to achieve:

[Please note: Reignite decided to adopt this technology
following the recommendations of an EWB-UK
Sanitary Engineer that spend 3 months working with us in Bambui. All the
materials needed to build this infrastructure are being sold in the local
market and technicians have been trained on how to build it]
Now all we and the Bambui Community
need, is just a little bit of extra help to make it happen.

story:
Summary of event and why to donate


  • Hi, I am pretty new to long distance cycling, only did 40k up to 3 weeks ago and plan to do this 300K cycle in two days with my local GAA club, on the bank holiday weekend this 2014.
  • This campaign is the main fundraiser for Fingalians GAA Club the oldest GAA club in Ireland (Est. 1884). 10% of fundraising will go to the Irish Heart foundation
  • By raising these funds it will ensure that the oldest GAA club in Ireland continues to grow and develop children into a life long love of the sport. Through Go Games, the non competitive style will help young children develop skills rather than just highlight winning, thus keeping kids interested over a longer term.
story_txt:
Summary of event and why to donate

Hi, I am pretty new to long distance cycling, only did 40k up to 3 weeks ago and plan to do this 300K cycle in two days with my local GAA club, on the bank holiday weekend this 2014.

This campaign is the main fundraiser for Fingalians GAA Club the oldest GAA club in Ireland (Est. 1884). 10% of fundraising will go to the Irish Heart foundation

By raising these funds it will ensure that the oldest GAA club in Ireland continues to grow and develop children into a life long love of the sport. Through Go Games, the non competitive style will help young children develop skills rather than just highlight winning, thus keeping kids interested over a longer term.
